marketNews.title: Dividend Compilation with Yield >4%
marketNews.content: Entering mid-May 2025, an increasing number of issuers have held extraordinary general shareholders' meetings (RUPST) and set dividend distributions for fiscal year 2024. Stockbit has compiled a list of issuers that will distribute dividends, with the cum-date still upcoming and a minimum yield of 4% based on the market close today, Wednesday (28/5). The details are as follows. Key Takeaway: Based on the table above, issuers generally set a dividend payout ratio (DPR) for fiscal year 2024 that is relatively stable compared to fiscal year 2023. However, we observe a tendency of increasing DPR among state-owned enterprises, such as TLKM and the state-owned banking group including BMRI (2024: 78%, 2023: 60%), BBRI (2024: 86%, 2023: 80%), BBNI (2024: 65%, 2023: 50%) and BBTN (2024: 25%, 2023: 20%) following the formation and transition of state-owned enterprises to BPI Danantara. PTBA is a state-owned issuer that is attractive to watch for its upcoming dividend, as the company will hold an RUPST on 12 June 2025.

marketNews.title: Guidance HRUM 2025: Nickel Production Up, Coal Down
marketNews.content:
1. HRUM: Chief Executive Officer of Harum Energy, Ray Antonio Gunara, said that the company targets production of nickel pig iron and high-grade nickel matte of about 71,000-75,000 tonnes in 2025 (versus 2024 realization of 56,998 tonnes), with nickel ore production targeted at 1.8-2.5 million wet metric tonnes (versus 2024 realization of 963,028 wet metric tonnes). Meanwhile, coal production for 2025 is targeted at 5-5.5 million tonnes (versus 2024 realization of 6.1 million tonnes). HRUM will allocate capex of USD 315 million in 2025 (versus 2024 realization of USD 226.9 million), of which USD 300 million will be used for development of existing nickel business units and the remainder for maintenance of coal business units.
2. GOTO: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia will seek shareholder approval to cancel a private placement up to 10% of the authorized and paid-in capital in the extraordinary shareholders' meeting on 18 June 2025. Previously, GOTO obtained approval to carry out a private placement in the rights-issue meeting on 30 August 2024, which could be executed until 30 August 2025. GOTO did not detail the reason for the cancellation, but explained that the cancellation is due to management considerations and current market conditions.
3. TINS: The Audit Board of Indonesia (BPK) estimates that Timah may incur a loss of approximately IDR 34.5 trillion due to loss of tin resources caused by illegal mining activities in the company's mining concession areas from 2013 to the first half of 2023.
4. DILD: Shareholders of Intiland Development approved a plan to change the composition of the board of directors and commissioners for the 2025-2030 period. Archied Noto Pradono, previously director of capital management and investment, was appointed as the new president director, while Simon Joseph Wirawan, previously a director in a DILD business entity, joined as a board member. Sofyan A. Djalil and Sinarto Dharmawan swapped positions, becoming the principal commissioner and deputy principal commissioner respectively. Shareholders also approved Alexander S. Rusli as a new independent commissioner.
5. HILL: The controlling shareholder of Hillcon, PT Hillcon Equity Management, sold 38 million HILL shares at IDR 358 per share on 23 May 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 13.6 billion. After this transaction, PT Hillcon Equity Management's ownership in HILL fell from 56.75% to 56.49%.
6. WIRG: The controlling shareholder of Wir Asia, PT WIR Global Kreatif, sold 75 million WIRG shares at an average price of IDR 81 per share on 27 May 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 6 billion and was intended as an internal strategy. After this transaction, PT WIR Global Kreatif's ownership in WIRG decreased from about 9.02% to about 8.39%.
7. BMAS: The company secretary of Bank Maspion Indonesia, Iwan Djayawasita, said that the company is conducting due diligence with several prospective strategic investors as part of complying with the free-float regulation. Iwan explained that there is one foreign investor from Japan that will become a strategic investor in BMAS, while several local investors are still in the due-diligence process. Public ownership in BMAS as of the end of April 2025 was only 1.56%, whereas the minimum free-float requirement is 7.5%.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know
marketNews.content:
1. Bloomberg reported that Bridgewater Associates founder Ray Dalio chose not to become an advisor to BPI Danantara for reasons not disclosed. The Bloomberg report came only two months after several government officials announced plans for Dalio's involvement as an advisor to BPI Danantara. Meanwhile, BPI Danantara CEO Rosan Roeslani denied the rumor.
2. Energy and Mineral Resources Minister Bahlil Lahadalia claimed that Indonesia's gas lifting reached 1,206 mboepd in 1Q25, equal to 120% of the 2025 APBN target. Oil lifting reached 580,000 bpd in 1Q25, equal to 96% of the target.
3. US consumer confidence rose 12.3 points to a level of 98 in May 2025, surpassing the consensus expectation of 87 points. The result marks the first increase in US consumer confidence after five consecutive months of decline amid the escalating US-China trade war.
4. German Foreign Minister Johann Wadephul opened the possibility that Germany might stop exporting weapons to Israel if Israel continues attacks on Palestine. Reuters reported that Wadephul's statement marked a significant shift in Germany's tone toward Israel, which has been a strong supporter through its "Staatsraison" policy. The European Union is also reviewing its policy toward Israel, while the United Kingdom, France, and Canada have threatened concrete actions over Israel's continued attacks.
5. The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) on Tuesday (27/5) condemned US President Donald Trump's tariff proposal, citing uncertainty in trade and emphasizing the need for trade diversification. The US is the largest export market for Southeast Asia. ASEAN said it will continue constructive dialogue with the US and will not take retaliatory measures. Bloomberg also reported that ASEAN expressed concerns about the risk of their markets being flooded with Chinese goods originally intended for US export.
6. The House of Representatives has received a proposal for two candidates for the Deputy Governor of Bank Indonesia for the 2025-2030 period, nominated by President Prabowo Subianto: Dicky Kartikoyono, currently head of the Payment Systems Policy Department at Bank Indonesia, and Ricky Perdana Gozali, head of the Bank Indonesia Jakarta Province Representative Office. Deputy Chair of Commission XI of the DPR, Fauzi Amro, said the discussion on the two candidates will take place after the DPR recess, expected in July 2025.
7. Housing and Settlement Affairs Minister Maruarar Sirait announced on Tuesday (27/5) that the government approved an increase in the subsidized mortgage loan quota for 2025 from 220,000 units to 350,000 units. The related regulation will be issued soon. Maruarar added that the State-owned Banks Association (Himbara) has committed to channel 85% of the total quota. BP Tapera Commissioner Heru Pudyo Nugroho said the increased subsidized mortgage quota adds managed funds by IDR 16.4 trillion to around IDR 34.4 trillion.

marketNews.content: "Thus, we can conclude that becoming rich cannot be instant; it requires a process unless one inherits wealth or wins the lottery." - Ganymeda1101

tickerNews.content: BBNI's dividend payout ratio (DPR) was 65% in 2024, up from 50% in 2023.

tickerNews.content: BTBN's dividend payout ratio (DPR) was 25% in 2024, up from 20% in 2023.

tickerNews.title: PTBA upcoming dividend and RUPST
tickerNews.content: PTBA is highlighted as an attractive state-owned issuer whose dividend is expected soon, with the company planning to hold an extraordinary general shareholders' meeting (RUPST) on 12 June 2025.

tickerNews.title: HRUM 2025 production targets and capex
tickerNews.content: HRUM targets nickel pig iron and high-grade nickel matte production of about 71,000-75,000 tonnes in 2025 (vs. 56,998 tonnes in 2024) and nickel ore production of 1.8-2.5 million wet metric tonnes (vs. 963,028 wet metric tonnes in 2024). Coal production is targeted at 5-5.5 million tonnes in 2025 (vs. 6.1 million tonnes in 2024). HRUM will allocate USD 315 million capex in 2025, with USD 300 million for existing nickel business development and the remainder for coal business maintenance.

tickerNews.title: GOTO cancels private placement up to 10% of capital
tickerNews.content: GOTO will seek shareholder approval to cancel a private placement of up to 10% of the authorized and paid-in capital in the extraordinary shareholders' meeting on 18 June 2025. The cancellation is attributed to management considerations and current market conditions.

tickerNews.title: TINS potential loss due to illegal mining
tickerNews.content: The Audit Board of Indonesia (BPK) estimates that Timah (TINS) may incur a loss of approximately IDR 34.5 trillion because of loss of tin resources caused by illegal mining activities in its concession areas from 2013 to the first half of 2023.

tickerNews.title: DILD board and commissioner reshuffle approved
tickerNews.content: Intiland Development shareholders approved changes to the board of directors and commissioners for the 2025-2030 period. Archied Noto Pradono was appointed president director, Simon Joseph Wirawan joined as a director, Sofyan A. Djalil and Sinarto Dharmawan swapped roles as principal commissioner and deputy principal commissioner, and Alexander S. Rusli was approved as a new independent commissioner.

tickerNews.title: HILL shares sold by controlling shareholder
tickerNews.content: PT Hillcon Equity Management sold 38 million HILL shares at IDR 358 per share on 23 May 2025, totaling approximately IDR 13.6 billion. After the transaction, its ownership in HILL decreased from 56.75% to 56.49%.

tickerNews.title: WIRG shares sold by controlling shareholder

tickerNews.title: BMAS free-float due diligence and ownership level
tickerNews.content: Bank Maspion Indonesia (BMAS) is conducting due diligence with several prospective strategic investors to meet the free-float requirement. One foreign investor from Japan is expected to become a strategic investor, while several local investors are still in due-diligence. Public ownership in BMAS as of the end of April 2025 was only 1.56%, below the minimum free-float requirement of 7.5%.
